title: Saw a tiger close up
review_text: The zoo is a nice place to take kids. For me the highlight was seeing the tiger. Huge and powerful, amazing creature.

title: good
review_text: very good .i visited here last month ,with my some teenager friends ,i enjoyed here very much it is very enjoyfull

title: Memories!!
review_text: This is a place I had been to as a child and so when a cousin of mine asked me to accompany her with a group of children I didn't mind.Well I wasn't interested in seeing the animals but was keen to see how other people ,especially children enjoyed. The place was not too crowded, being a weekday I guess. The children went berserk seeing the animals and birds and it gave me a good feeling that all is not lost..as kids today are more interested in mobiles and other gadgets. A good experience altogether!!

title: Zoo Garden of Kolkata
review_text: Zoological Garden of Kolkata is located in the Alipore area of Kolkata. Nearest Railhead is Rabindra Sadan Metro Station. Here many species of animals have been kept. It will take whole day to enjoy the garden.

title: Family Time!
review_text: Lovely place and I miss the Bijoli Grill hotel at the corner. Best place to visit during new year or holidays especially for kids

title: Well maintained, good collections
review_text: Visited several times. Good collection of different species of animals, reptiles and birds. Well maintained. Very popular place among locals for a day's outing.

title: KOLKATA ZOO & ZOOLOGICAL GARDEN
review_text: A trip to the Alipore zoo is always a nice experience. They have a large number of animals and it is extremely spacious. I've been to zoos in bombay, bangalore and lucknow as well but the alipore zoo is the best in terms of the overall family experience. It's really big and there're lots of lawns for families to sit down.

title: Jungle Book
review_text: Life is more than you see the creation of god good place in zoo different varieties of animals which only you can see on Tv

title: Zoo
review_text: Kolkata Zoo is a popular well known zoo.You can see many animals , reptiles etcetera and forget about time.

title: Suprisingly neat and attractive
review_text: I visited this place after many years, to get my son aquantited with animals which he had seen in books so far. Contrary to the infamous opinion about the lack of cleanliness and dearth of animals, we found this place quite neat and well maintained. Despite covering a big area, the appropriately placed signboards make navigation convenient. Abundant deers, giraffes, peacocks and a wild variety of birds make for a very pleasant trip. Yes there are just a couple of tigers and lions and placed at a more-than-formidable distance, however, that is quite a sight. By the time we finished watching the elephants and were considering looking for the exit, we found it right in front of us. Overall a very pleasant trip. More

review_text: Yes i visit here again. Its a my of those favorite place which is i wanted to visit again and again. This place for every one, for any ages. Alipore zoo one of the oldest place in Kolkata. Many things here for explore i mean any animals here to watch. If you spent your weekend with child and family you must go there.. i just love this place.

title: Animals with animals
review_text: Extremely essential visiting place, for all ages, to get a face to face contact with great tigers, lions, elephants, crocodiles, snakes, jaguars, ziraffes, deers, bears, camels and what not?

title: Child Memory refreshed
review_text:
The day was nostalgic. Liked the ease of e-ticketing. 30 per head and 250 with movie camera. The entry gate is separate and no rush. But the lady in the counter did not check our identity, though the instruction says one need to carry id proof; which may be proved to be a lacunae if something serious happens in this day of terrorism. No security check also in this gate. Counter ticket and the entry was full of people. The status and count of the animals - is actually poor, but only because it is a place with one of my best childhood memories, I have marked average. in each cage you have one one animal, like one lonely lioness(no lion), one rhino (without horn), one sloth bear, 2 elephant kids (6 years and 8 years), one Jackal in miserable state, 4-5 crocodiles, 2 - 3 chimpanzees, kangaroos were not mature, 1 jaguar, 1 cheetah, few tigers in enclosed cage (old fashioned), 1 white tiger in the open arena but was sleeping, a couple of deer each of different categories in their concerned open enclosures, 1 hippo(again sleeping like a mass), Few Giraffe,few Zebras, 1 white peacock with it's lady, one peacock with its family..... the collection of birds are really good, but again alone in the cages in most cases(though I am not aware of their habitat, but birds are generally lives in community, so also Lion and Elephant.... The day was nostalgic. Liked the ease of e-ticketing. 30 per head and 250 with movie camera. The entry gate is separate and no rush. But the lady in the counter did not check our identity, though the instruction says one need to carry id proof; which may be proved to be a lacunae if something serious happens in this day of terrorism. No security check also in this gate. Counter ticket and the entry was full of people. 

The status and count of the animals - is actually poor, but only because it is a place with one of my best childhood memories, I have marked average. in each cage you have one one animal, like one lonely lioness(no lion), one rhino (without horn), one sloth bear, 2 elephant kids (6 years and 8 years), one Jackal in miserable state, 4-5 crocodiles, 2 - 3 chimpanzees, kangaroos were not mature, 1 jaguar, 1 cheetah, few tigers in enclosed cage (old fashioned), 1 white tiger in the open arena but was sleeping, a couple of deer each of different categories in their concerned open enclosures, 1 hippo(again sleeping like a mass), Few Giraffe,few Zebras, 1 white peacock with it's lady, one peacock with its family..... the collection of birds are really good, but again alone in the cages in most cases(though I am not aware of their habitat, but birds are generally lives in community, so also Lion and Elephant. 

Food stalls are there but options are redundant. I do not find the food courts (if they are at all termed so) are hygienic, lot of flies and open foods are sold; so better to carry your own food. though they say it is a plastic free (!) zone, but food stalls are themselves selling juices and lassy in plastic glasses or lab-based thermocol plates! Otherwise small wraps made of "newspaper" with the beautiful and colourful newsprints! 

Drinking water again primitive supply system, not dependable. They are selling packaged drinking water of low grade companies. So again be self-reliant. 

Worst part is washrooms. Lot of urine units, half-level doors as they cater to same sex, so you need not to bother for privacy and you can't even lock from in-side (obvious reason is other can see your presence from outside)! Two-three closed doors are there but to be used as latrine and condition is not usable as stools are visible, while urine can't be seen in plain eyes, so you are bound to use the half door ones. Water supply pipe-line is there but no mugs to apply. In short, filthy and no privacy. In the duration of 3 and half hours, I used once, I have not noticed any attendant to clean. My husband's feedback about the male urinals are also same. It's a shame! 

There is no arrangement of any activity for the animals in their enclosures, not outside for the kids (like toy trains, play tools etc). Lots of grounds are there where people are sitting and doing family picnics amidst dust. No cart for carrying aged people, so avoid if you have aged people in the group or expect walking. 

No parking owned by the zoo authority! So avoid personal vehicle. 

In short, in Kolkata, if you do not have to go anywhere and you have never got a scope to experience what a zoo is, come to Calcutta Zoo. Better to avoid. I have been to Darjeeling Zoo, Mysore Zoo, Bangalore Zoo, Vizag Zoo, Delhi Zoo, Nainital Zoo and on top of all Nandan Kanan in Bhubaneshwar; these all are gems of keeping the animals in Captivity. Hope the feedback helps others. More

title: Old memories....refreshed
review_text:
When I was a kid, I used to visit the Calcutta zoo with my dad, almost every month! The last time was in my high school years in the early '90s. So, it was a trip down the memory lane when I visited the same old zoo again a few days ago....after decades, and was pleasantly surprised to find it the same and well kept. In fact I found it to be a lot cleaner and better maintained than before. The glass covered viewing shelters at the tiger, leopard and kangaroo enclosures, provide an unrestricted view of the magnificent animals....the star attractions undoubtedly being the five bengal tigers (2 white and 3 natural) that we saw. The white tiger made a majestic appearance and leisurely walked past the glass separation a couple of times, could clearly see every movement at a distance of just a few feet. As mentioned before, the entire area is pretty well maintained, especially keeping in mind the kind of footfall it experiences, dotted with snacks/ice-cream counters all around. But I do need to say here that we as a race, need to be better mannered and be conscious about littering. There is an entry fee of Rs. 30/- per head (no time limit) and the zoo keeps open from 9am to 5pm, Friday to Wednesday (closed on Thursday). There are three entrances, the main one being on the Alipore Road. Among the other two entrances,... When I was a kid, I used to visit the Calcutta zoo with my dad, almost every month! The last time was in my high school years in the early '90s. So, it was a trip down the memory lane when I visited the same old zoo again a few days ago....after decades, and was pleasantly surprised to find it the same and well kept. In fact I found it to be a lot cleaner and better maintained than before. The glass covered viewing shelters at the tiger, leopard and kangaroo enclosures, provide an unrestricted view of the magnificent animals....the star attractions undoubtedly being the five bengal tigers (2 white and 3 natural) that we saw. The white tiger made a majestic appearance and leisurely walked past the glass separation a couple of times, could clearly see every movement at a distance of just a few feet. 
As mentioned before, the entire area is pretty well maintained, especially keeping in mind the kind of footfall it experiences, dotted with snacks/ice-cream counters all around. But I do need to say here that we as a race, need to be better mannered and be conscious about littering. There is an entry fee of Rs. 30/- per head (no time limit) and the zoo keeps open from 9am to 5pm, Friday to Wednesday (closed on Thursday). There are three entrances, the main one being on the Alipore Road. Among the other two entrances, one is on the National Library Avenue, just next to the crossing as you turn towards DH Road, and the other one is on Orphangunge Road, for people coming from the Khidderpore side. I'd recommend you to visit the website of the zoo beforehand. 
And of course, this is a "must visit" for your Calcutta experience to be complete. 
P.S. Avoid taking your own car, severe shortage of parking in and around the zoo. More

title: Kolkata Zoological Garden
review_text: We have recently visited Zoological Garden in Kolkata this winter. It is situated at Alipore. You can not only enjoy watching various species of animals and birds, but also you can arrange family picnics.It is an wonderful place especially for children. But remember one thing do not harm or disturb any animals.

title: Enclosed animals
review_text: Kolkata zoo is not so well maintained when compared to other south indian Zoos. The crowd was less when I visited.

title: Great enjoyment
review_text: We are very enjoy in the zoological garden. The ticket price is so cheap only 30RS. You can buy tickets online.

title: Best picnic spot
review_text: In winter very good picnic here. You also buy ticket online RS 30.lots of animal you see in the zoo.

title: Hurrrrrayyyyy... It's Zoo Day
review_text:
I think this is the top of the places in Kolkata which is enjoyable equally by children and grown ups. One of the famous zoological gardens of India to get in touch of variety of wild animals, numerous number of birds and vegetation.If you manage to go to the zoo even every year, every time you experience a happiness in your mind, not a bit of monotony can touch you. 

My little daughter really enjoyed the real Tiger, Lion, Elephant, Zebra, Deer...and couldn't believed their existence as she used to look them in her books and television until she came to the zoo. 

The zoo is well maintained and staffs are really doing good. You are allowed to carry your own food ,but plastic bags are a big NO. But lack of proper supervision and security check, some people are still carrying plastic bags. I also noticed lots of people throwing plastic cups, ice cream cups, plastic spoons beside and in the main water body. Though there are many washrooms, some stupid parents made their kids to pee beside the path. These type of acts are need to be stopped by strict supervision. More

title: All time favorite
review_text: I have been visiting this zoo since I was a kid. Winter holiday, a basket fool of food few for us few for the animals. Tigers,lions,crocodiles,giraffes,snakes,leopards,deer,and my favorite bears every thing.This place is an emotion.Perfect for a family picnic place.

title: Better identification on the trees than at the botanical garden.
review_text: Spacious, well landscaped park with a diverse range of tree species, each of which is identified in Bengali and English, much better than the trees in the botanical garden itself. Less surprisingly, there is a good collection of animals, too.

title: refreshing experience and wide ranging species of animals.
review_text:
Unlike many other "attractions" in Kolkata, my experience of the Alipore Zoo was refreshing. I went with my two year old son who, like me, had a great time. I was very impressed with the different kinds of animals and birds. Wide ranging and very diverse. Some very fascinating like the "Slow Loris" - I have not seen a primate move slower then that. The animals appear to be well looked after. There is a sense of openness, which is comforting given a zoo by its very nature is restrictive. Not surprisingly, there are several royal Bengal tigers, all well built and healthy. I do feel the enclosures for the tigers, Rhino and hippo could do with some improvement/ enhancement. Signage is a problem, but thats alright as it adds to the fun and excitement. Its important that you get there early and be prepared to spend a better part of the day there if you want to explore the zoo in its entirety. With the lovely weather in Kolkata in the months of Nov-Feb, now is a great time to visit the Zoo. Be prepared to walk. The ticket booking system needs to be looked at. Especially the online booking side of it. I lost money because my online payment did not go through. Also, the security guards, all great guys, need to be a little more pro-active when dealing with errant and mischievous patrons. we came across a... Unlike many other "attractions" in Kolkata, my experience of the Alipore Zoo was refreshing. I went with my two year old son who, like me, had a great time. 

I was very impressed with the different kinds of animals and birds. Wide ranging and very diverse. Some very fascinating like the "Slow Loris" - I have not seen a primate move slower then that. 

The animals appear to be well looked after. There is a sense of openness, which is comforting given a zoo by its very nature is restrictive. 

Not surprisingly, there are several royal Bengal tigers, all well built and healthy. I do feel the enclosures for the tigers, Rhino and hippo could do with some improvement/ enhancement. 

Signage is a problem, but thats alright as it adds to the fun and excitement. Its important that you get there early and be prepared to spend a better part of the day there if you want to explore the zoo in its entirety. With the lovely weather in Kolkata in the months of Nov-Feb, now is a great time to visit the Zoo. Be prepared to walk. 

The ticket booking system needs to be looked at. Especially the online booking side of it. I lost money because my online payment did not go through. 

Also, the security guards, all great guys, need to be a little more pro-active when dealing with errant and mischievous patrons. we came across a few and I was quite frustrated to see that they could get away with their tom-foolery and general bad behaviour, whether towards the animals or generally maintaining hygiene and cleanliness. Frustration was increased because the Zoo otherwise is clean and well maintained. 

Finally, a very nice feature about the Zoo is it gives you the option to adopt an animal. Its a great idea, which not only ensures funding for the Zoo but gives animal lovers the opportunity to care for the animals, albeit, vicariously. I am considering adopting the Slow Loris! More

title: ALIPORE ZOO
review_text:
I got three tickets on line @ Rs.30/- per person. From Dumdum to Aliporeit took exactly 36 minutes. 
Gates opened at 9am. The ticket counters are separate. There is a food court. From the main entrance turn left where the orang otang is located, then deer , and at the opposite is the zebra.Then walking back we saw the Snake house,Lion,tigers,hippos,zirraffe. Lucky to see all the animals. They were well looked after.Kangaroos were inside the AC room. Toilets and drinking water well located. Zoo very neat and clean.To go round it took about five hours.

title: Visit to Alipore zoo
review_text: It's a fabolous place to visit with family and friends for taking experience of joyful and enjoyable day, One can able to see animals of several kinds and even international animals are available, It's a must place to visit with family and friends

title: Good
review_text: It is pretty big with decent variety of animals. If travelling with a kid then one can visit the place. It has a lake inside where you can watch variety of birds as well

title: Good
review_text: Very good zoological park / zoo . good verities of animal & birds . i visited here last month .very enjoyed.

title: Its an awesome place to visit with family.
review_text: Kolkata zoo has got a wide range of animals and birds and reptiles. It has got a restaurant inside providing good food. Recently it has been renovated. And new species of animals brought in. Tigers are amazing. Great place.

title: Nice place to catch a glimpse of animals
review_text: Nice place to catch some glimpse of wild animals within the city. This is one of the oldest zoos in India and has a good collection of wild animals. Kids would find this place to be a good hangout place to be at

title: Interesting place for all
review_text: Kolkata zoological graden is situated at Alipore. Famous and old zoo of India. A large no. of animals are there. Every year in winter season, it experiences huge no. of visitors. One who comes in kolkata with kids, it is a must visit place

title: Best zoo in India after Mysore Zoo.
review_text:
Very big and well maintained zoo, containing a variety of animals not usually found all together in other zoos. Zebras, Giraffe, different types of Apes, pheasants, crocodiles, birds etc. are all present in this zoo. 
Lots of fishes can be seen in the waterbodies inside the zoo, and bats and fishing birds can be seen outside the cages. 
One should plan for at least 2-3 hrs. for visiting this zoo. It is better to visit at the earliest in the morning, otherwise the tigers, lions, leopards etc. take rest inside their cages and cannot be seen. Also, it is easy to get a ticket in the first hour of opening. 
It is a must-see if you have young children. More

title: A good place for winter outings
review_text: It will be a very fun place for kids as well as adults. Though you won't find all the animals here but even then nowadays you will get to see most of them. This place is also well connected and has many small food stalls and shops inside.

title: A great place for children.
review_text:
I had visited there last week with my family. My younger brother love to see animals,there are a lot of animals. Like tigers and lions and many bird species as well as snakes and many lizards. The crocodile was so awesome and the rhino looks angry. 
I request all of you to visit there at least once.

title: Lots of Animals!
review_text: One of the best zoos with a wide variety of animals inside. The entry fare is 30 rupees for adults and the fee is justified completely for the number of animal species that are available for display inside. Also, you will find eateries inside the zoo so no need to worry for hunger when inside. Look out for Giraffes, Lion, Tiger and Rhinos

title: good
review_text: this is a small zoo in alipore kolkata. best attraction here is royal Bengal tiger and white tiger...

title: A shadow of it's past
review_text: The iconic zoo in Kolkata, founded by royalty, is in complete shambles. While much effort has been made to improve the living conditions of the animals, the services for the visitors are just awful. On busy winter days the bins are overflowing with garbage and the staff are too overwhelmed by the problem. Visiting during the off-season (summer and monsoon) can be a better experience depending on the weather. For the sake of the zoo, do not bring your own food as it just adds to the garbage problem.

title: Needs Improvement
review_text: The condition of the animals is good. The zoo is a lot cleaner now. The Kolkata Zoo is quite big and old. And because of its size you shall always find some part of it being repaired. The good thing is that the authorities are constantly trying to give this place a facelift. However a lot more needs to be done.

title: Very good zoo to visit
review_text: Layout of the zoo is good with good signages. Variety of animals good. Elephant, tiger, lion, hippo. Giraffe enclosure was superb. Huge variety of birds, peacock, Macau etc. Crocodile was awesome. Great place for young children. Around 80%International standards I must say, having seen and if I compare with the Singapore zoo..

title: Zoo trip
review_text: Visited zoo with family and Young kid's,enjoyed the day there ,seeing all wild animals it's reminds me my childhood days.how excited I was I my childhood to see the animals. It good to see the zoo is neat and clean.

title: Zoo
review_text: What a place .this is very good zoo in West Bengal here lots of animals are Hare .The Royal Bengal Tiger is also here the beauty of Bengal is here. many birds are there. it is a very good combination of animals and birds beautiful birds. very good place for chilling or enjoying with your family I am loving it.

title: Ideal Place for Children

title: Heart of the city of joy
review_text: This zoo is very old (well maintained) and historical places all over the India. It is huge places. So many animals is there. I think everybody enjoy this place. You can royal bengol tiger, Brazilian birds, very old tree etc. Inside food is horrible like burgers, hot dog, patient etc. Entrance gate staff attitude is very route.

review_text: A very good place best for children here you can see many type of animal you can came here by bus.Thanks You

So ... Very nice...

title: Kind of a sad zoo
review_text: Went to the Kolkata zoo with some friends and although it was a nice escape from the city, the zoo was pretty dilapidated and the animals didn’t look all that well cared for. Glad I went, but not my favorite place to visit in Kolkata.

title: Just any zoo of India...
review_text: Zoo.. well all zoos are almost same in India. And in this summer hot conditions, mostly all animals are hidden inside their houses or dens. So tough to see them up close. Area is huge, unfortunately you have to walk through, no mini train or van to help you out here. Thats a big con. Snacks available inside like Ice cream, water,... Good zoo, but nothing special.

title: Alipore zoo garden
review_text: Alipur zoological garden awesome experience. Wow , again I want to go there, big zoo, big place, varius types of animals

title: Zoo
review_text: Superb place..A well organised area.can enjoy nature at its bottom.Lots of animals to see here.Zoo entry price is appropriate.very good place to visit at weekends.

title: Animals are the best friends living on Earth
review_text: I visited the ALIPORE Zoo my son of 16 years along with my niece Kyra who is 4 yrs. It rained and the day was cloudy so the zoo was comparatively low turnout which quite suited us. The tiger in the open enclosure was in his elements. The Baboons looked tired at 1pm. Birds seemed in a joyful mood. The reptile house was under renovation. The gardens all around looked green and well manicured. Easily one of the best Zoological gardens of INDIA with a large variety of animals and birds.

title: Tired old zoo very dirty and dusty
review_text:
This zoo was across the road form our accommodation 
Very cheap but so dirty so cramped and the animals appeared well fed but in cramped conditions

title: Even whole day would be insufficient
review_text:
This zoo is huge. It has too much space and is much better maintained as compared to those in Mumbai. 
One thing, you need to factor in while you visit is that you have to walk a lot. There are many enclosures and each enclosure is not side by side. 
Don't miss the Royal Bengal Tiger!!

title: Kolkata Zoo
review_text: Once being the one of the best zoo in the country now has lost all his charm, located in Alipore. It also use to have Royal bengal tiger

title: Lot of variety
review_text: Quite a fascinating place with lot of variety of animals. You can find white tigers here. The campus is huge and has lot of facilities for visitors

title: Zoo park
review_text: This park is containing many animals and birds. The proper care have been taking regarding their protection and habitat. I have seen many species that we count see outside.

title: Fun and Adventurous !!!
review_text:
So how do you review a Zoo. well its tge children that could give the best rating on the measure of fun they had. 
if you are a local or a tourist in Kolkata, take time to visit especially with young ones. 
the place is quite big and well spread out. 
inside you will find maps and directions to the exquisite variety of animals and birds. 
best time to visit is during weekdays in winter (if possible as weekends and holidays draw a huge crowd). 

snacks and soft beverages are available inside but you can carry your own food. best as it can double as a picnic spot. just take care not too feed the animals ! 
carry plenty of drinking water. 

entry fee is there but nominal. 

have fun . More

title: Good Zoo, but need lots of improvements
review_text:
The Zoological Garden, Kolkata Zoo, Alipore was established in the year 1875, with its lush green lawn, greeneries, peace and tranquillity situated within one of the busiest cities of India, the “City of Joy”, Kolkata • Ticket counter of the zoo opens at 09:00 am & closes at 04:30 p.m. • Garden opening Time is 09:00 am & closing time is 05:00 pm. Usually Zoo remains closed to the visitors on every Thursday. If any holiday falls on Thursday, the garden remains open to the visitors on that day and the weekly closure is observed on the next available working day. * BUT generally Zoo, remains open on every Thursday between 15th December to 31st January Entrance fee : Up to the age of 5 years - Rs. 10/- , above the age of 5 years: Rs.30/- For the aquarium : Rs. 5 / - per person , Video Photography : Rs. 250 /- per hour You can buy ticket online ticket as well @ Kolkata Zoo web site. No Car parking place. Free wheelchair available for the aged/ handicap person at the entrance gate. Just ask the security person he/she can guide you. The highlight is probably the Bengal tigers, confusingly in a number of enclosures and spread around the back of the park. Other attractions include the white tiger, white peacock and a selection of Indian birds and animals. good place to visit with family & kids for... The Zoological Garden, Kolkata Zoo, Alipore was established in the year 1875, with its lush green lawn, greeneries, peace and tranquillity situated within one of the busiest cities of India, the “City of Joy”, Kolkata 
• Ticket counter of the zoo opens at 09:00 am & closes at 04:30 p.m. 
• Garden opening Time is 09:00 am & closing time is 05:00 pm. 
Usually Zoo remains closed to the visitors on every Thursday. If any holiday falls on Thursday, the garden remains open to the visitors on that day and the weekly closure is observed on the next available working day. 
* BUT generally Zoo, remains open on every Thursday between 15th December to 31st January 

Entrance fee : 

Up to the age of 5 years - Rs. 10/- , above the age of 5 years: Rs.30/- 
For the aquarium : Rs. 5 / - per person , Video Photography : Rs. 250 /- per hour 
You can buy ticket online ticket as well @ Kolkata Zoo web site. 

No Car parking place. 

Free wheelchair available for the aged/ handicap person at the entrance gate. Just ask the security person he/she can guide you. 

The highlight is probably the Bengal tigers, confusingly in a number of enclosures and spread around the back of the park. Other attractions include the white tiger, white peacock and a selection of Indian birds and animals. 
good place to visit with family & kids for a day out. Children will be happy to see different types of animals, birds, snakes etc. 
The place is mostly crowded , especially during winter weekends its over crowded. Very large area, variety of animals. Be prepared to walk as it is very tiring to cover the entire area. There are plenty of icecream stalls inside, but very few food stalls. So plan to carry food from home, but ensure that you dispose the waste in the dustbins only. 
The zoo is famed for its white tiger and Bengal tiger, but features a number of other indigenous animals, some unknown to people outside India. It also has kangaroos, zebras, and other more standard zoo animals. All animals have large enclosures and are well looked after. There are also a number of exotic trees marked in the park. 

Only Bad thing is that, though Alipur zoo is the oldest zoo in the country but the animals are in such a bad condition no one can understand. Each and every animal enclosure were smelly.The tiger were skinny and not active. Eelephants water pounds were dirty, there were lots of garbage all scattered around. It was very heartbreaking to see our national bird and animal ( tiger & peacock)in such a bad condition. There was a articles in newspapers to adopt the animals many have been adopted but still there is no change. I would like to request Bengal government/Zoo Management to take care of these. More

title: Major attraction of Calcutta
review_text:
Situated in the heart of Calcutta, surrounded by major avenues running along its perimeter, the Calcutta Zoological Garden is a major attraction for school children, visitors to the city from surrounding districts and the local residents. 
It is the oldest zoo of India and until some years back was the foster home to a giant tortoise, who was claimed to have lived 250 years.

title: For a lazy Sunday morning
review_text:
The zoo is in the heart of the city and although not well kept, has a reasonable size and collection. Not worth a detour but quite interesting for families with young children. 

The highlight is probably the Bengal tigers, confusingly in a number of enclosures and spread around the back of the park. Other attractions include the white tiger, white peacock and a selection of Indian birds and animals.

title: Best zoo of India
review_text:
Hello every1. I visited here as I was very excited and when I had the real experience after entering, really it was awesome. 
You can view all the birds, reptiles and animals inside the zoo of Indian origin with some foreign species. 

You have to give full day to visit the zoo because of its large area with lot of animals. 

Direct bus is available from Howrah station. 
Thursday closed.(opens other day- 9am to 5pm) 
Ticket price - 25/-(normal day, 30/-(sunday), 10/-(below 5 yr child).

title: one of the best zoo in india
review_text: kolkata zoo is good place for children and u will find different types of animal and birds here..entry fee is 30 rs ..i am very happy to see this place and i want to visit this place many times

title: Place of Fun in Kolkata
review_text: The zoo which I am enjoying since my childhood is quite nostalgic. Visiting every year with my child is a place for excitement for her. I think it is one of the busiest zoo during the winters in Kolkata. The authorities need to make some more strict rules for cleanliness and some more discipline required to be maintained. The zoo I think, must also work towards entertainment of children with some birds show, animal show, since circus shows have become rare. With the help of these shows, the government revenue may increase and the zoo can be enhanced to an international level.

title: Good for Children
review_text: Nice place to visit with family & kids. Children will be happy to see different types of animals, birds, snakes etc.

title: Must for a Kids Day Out
review_text: One of the oldest Zoo's in India, and one of Kolkata's best kept secrets! It was a wonderful place to visit with my kid.

title: Very good place
review_text: It is a very good place. There are many types of animals and plants in this place. I went there many times.

title: Absolute must visit for children
review_text: This was my 2nd visit to the Alipore zoo and indeed a great visit. The place is mostly crowded during winter weekends, but that doesn't pose as a hindrance. Very large area, variety of animals, new addition being the grey kangaroos. Be prepared to walk as it is very tiring to cover the entire area. There are plenty of icecream stalls inside, but very few food stalls. So plan to carry food from home, but ensure that you dispose the waste in the dustbins only. Overall, a great day trip to the zoo.

title: Overlooked by western tourists
review_text:
I've just returned from a visit to Kolkata zoo and it is a perfect refuge from the fervent activity of Kolkata. The zoo is famed for its white tiger and Bengal tiger, but features a number of other indigenous animals, some unknown to people outside India. It also has kangaroos, zebras, and other more standard zoo animals. All animals have large enclosures and are well looked after. There are also a number of exotic trees marked in the park like setting. 
The zoo is a nice place to people watch families and school groups, and for them to people watch you. While there we were asked to have our picture taken 3 times. Have fun! 

It is More

title: bengal times
review_text: zoo is famous for its bengal tiger,lions and other famous animals and birds.wow place to spend time.

title: The place for quintessential entertainment for kids of Kolkata (and beyond)
review_text:
We visited this zoo on the Christmas (25th) afternoon and the place was crowded to the brim and fatigued with dirt and leftovers. 
Location: In Alipore, near Taj Bengal and National Library, accessible by a host of public transport options. 
Tickets: Entry fee for Indian Adults is INR 30. The zoo has several entrances and exits. 
The collection of rare birds (colorful Cockatoos and exotic Parrots) is very good. Animals including multiple varieties of Deers are good attractions. Elephants, Lions, Giraffes and Tigers could strain your patience and eyes because of the way they are housed, their popularity amongst visitors and the safety fences that sets you aprt quite far.

title: Sudden plan
review_text: It is open from 9 am to 5 pm every day. However, it is closed on Thursdays. You can certainly have an amazing time there and if you are along with your family, this is going to the best gift for them. Watching the amazing animals and bird species like This proves the stunning beauty of the Alipore Zoological Garden.

title: excellent place to animal lover must visit place
review_text: This is very big and excellent place to animal lover must visit place and couple must visit this place also and many bird animal is watch here also.

title: Tour
review_text: This is a large zoo .this is at Aligarh .In this zoo many kinds of animals,birds and aquatic animals are available.

title: excellent one
review_text:
excellent place for outing & taking pics for families. 
very good place for lovers n couples too. 
basically i am not promoting this because of animal lover & i am not favour for zoo.

title: Better than before
review_text:
Winter is the season to take a trip to the Kolkata zoo. It is good to see that the maintenance job is much better than before and that the animals look to be in better physical health. Cuddos to the management for doing a good job. 
Word of caution: 
1. Do not tease the animals. 
2. Do not throw food at the animals. 
3. Do not try to show heroism by getting into/close to the cages. 
4. Holidays see a huge crowd. So pick your visit accordingly.

title: Very famous Zoo in West Bengal
review_text: Kolkata zoo is a very in India,West Bengal.This is very nice and natural place.every year i must visited with my family.

title: Most wonderful place.
review_text: One of the wonderful place in Kolkata. You can see all kinds of animals here. Ticket price is RS 30. And RS 10 for kids

title: hugely crowded
review_text: By Indian zoo standards, the Calcutta zoo does not fare badly. It remains a dusty place filled with sad looking animals. Avoid going there during the Christmas season as the crowds are huge.

title: Need More Animals!
review_text: The place is good enough for roaming around with family & kids. I felt there is a lack of animals. They need to improve the variety.

title: Visit to the Calcutta Zoo
review_text: The Zoological Gardens of Kolkata is very very old, perhaps more than 150 years and is located almost in the heart of the city. An excellent outing for the children! Adults also enjoy all the facilities

title: A fun morning.
review_text:
1) Cheap tickets: INR10 for kids 5 and under. INR30 for above 5s, so very reasonable. 
2) A variety of animals. 
3) Well laid-out zoo. Trees everywhere and open spaces. 
4) A rule stating there is no plastics or food allowed. HOWEVER there was plastic everywhere, and heaps of families sitting eating with their picnic food in plastic bags, then throwing the polythene bags in the bushes or just on the ground. Hilariously, plastic bottles were being sold inside the zoo at numerous venues , when there were many signs saying plastic bottles were not allowed. 
5) There was rubbish everywhere. Inside enclosures, outside enclosures, everywhere. You'd think, being India's oldest zoo, they'd take a special pridein looking after and keeping the grounds clean. Nope. 
6) Toilets were almost crime scenes. Ladies toilet had used nappies and bloody sanitary napkins stuffed in corners and balanced on top of walls. Absolutely disgusting. And this was right after the zoo had opened for the day, indicating their cleaning rota is pretty shabby. 

In short, if you can get past the dirt and filth, it's an interesting morning's time-pass with the kids. More

title: Animal Lovers
review_text: Once the largest zoo in Asia this zoo has fallen a few notches no doubt but still retains a huge variety of animal life and is a wonderful place to spend a day with the kids when in Kolkata. There are quite a few eateries near the entrance so food is not an issue for you to take a break during your visit. Post monsoon would be a good time to visit as we found that in summer most animals stay in their pens and viewing becomes a slight challenge.

title: Well maintained, well visited
review_text: Once largest zoo in Asia, still oldest in India. Vast range of mammals, avians, reptiles Indian as well as global, well fed and cared for. Positive points are-- state government takes keen interest and local people take great interest and pride in it.

title: Great Family outing in Kolkata
review_text: 1st thing is best to travel to this place is by public transportation.Parking opposite is always filled up by private cars for Taj/otherwise and another public parking place near jail is about 2 kms far.Park has an entry fee of 30 Rs. in Holiday periods it is maddengly crowded.avoid Sundays if possible.it has a fast food shops around main entrance.Has a good collection of tigers, crocs, different species of deers, giraffes,zebras, snakes,lion pair .A must see is a Giant Leatherback turtle.Bird collection is not that great but in winters some migratory birds sometimes are visible at the lake area of the zoo.Though its restricted to carry food and playing equipments but people tend to flout it at will and it becomes a being picnic area. More

title: Lots oc animals
review_text: Must visit place if you love animals. One can spot various species of life form here. Great place for outing to enjoy and spend time.

title: Zoo
review_text: It was a awesome day to spend some time with friends and family. The animals are very attractive and love to see

title: Zoooo ooohh!
review_text:
On 17th dec 2017 , it was a sunny sunday and we decided to visit Alipore zoological Garden . Its a kind of relieving our childhood and taking a tour in a down memory lane. Me and my wife packed sme dry foods like cake, snancks and water and headed for the zoo from our home Uttarpara at arund 11am. Luckily we reached there by 12pm due to less traffic, being a sunday I suppose,but we went berserk while parking the 2 wheeler. we made 3/4 rounds infront of the zoo for parking. The Traffic police are very much non cooperative while guiding for a proper 2 wheeler parking spot, may be its free or paid, need less to say about the civic volunteers. After making 3/4 rounds from n front of the zoo luckily we got a petrol pump we welcomed us for parking the bike at the parking fee Being Rs 100. After that we wrestled our way amidst the traffic and the crowd of the people to the zoo as the road was very congested with the zoo visitors with very poor traffic control system, after reaching the gate we again had to maintain our wrestling activities in order to get through it to the ticket counter. The ticket price is Rs 30 per person.We were totally berserk and tired when we finally made into the zoo. we paused on one side to have some water. then... On 17th dec 2017 , it was a sunny sunday and we decided to visit Alipore zoological Garden . Its a kind of relieving our childhood and taking a tour in a down memory lane. Me and my wife packed sme dry foods like cake, snancks and water and headed for the zoo from our home Uttarpara at arund 11am. Luckily we reached there by 12pm due to less traffic, being a sunday I suppose,but we went berserk while parking the 2 wheeler. we made 3/4 rounds infront of the zoo for parking. The Traffic police are very much non cooperative while guiding for a proper 2 wheeler parking spot, may be its free or paid, need less to say about the civic volunteers. After making 3/4 rounds from n front of the zoo luckily we got a petrol pump we welcomed us for parking the bike at the parking fee Being Rs 100. 
After that we wrestled our way amidst the traffic and the crowd of the people to the zoo as the road was very congested with the zoo visitors with very poor traffic control system, after reaching the gate we again had to maintain our wrestling activities in order to get through it to the ticket counter. The ticket price is Rs 30 per person.We were totally berserk and tired when we finally made into the zoo. we paused on one side to have some water. then we started roaming. It was amazing to find the number of people who have poured in to the zo0. The aimals can easily be counted in lieu of the people who were already there and still constantly pouring in. 
We chose one side from which we started to explore the zoo. Outside Each and every cage there is lots of heads one can spot. Its very difficult to spot any animal amass the crowd. One got to literally push one another to get a glimpse of the animal prevalent in the respective enclosures.And there are always some selfie maniacs who, after spotting the crowd is busy taking selfie withthe animal.While pushing our way through the crowd t visit one enclosure my wife got bruised on her left arm. After taking a 2 hr stroll that through amidst a sea of people who decided to return. 
We found theres no sitting place in the adjacent field areas among the zoo as many people brought cooked foods like rice, chicken , biriyani, paranthas, alurdom in dekchis and haris as well as in large tiffin carriers and many more food stuffs as if there was some picnic going on and watching the animals was just a secondary thing. The air was filled with the biriyani and chickens. 
We again wrestled our way towards the exit which took a long time coz of the continous wrestling and paving our way through the midst of the sea of the people and when we returned home we were cmpletely ut of energy, drained and devasted. We felt body aches on the next day as well which persisted for some days. 
My advice is to visit the zoo on any weekday though it reamins closed on Thursdays, Please avoid Sundays and other national holidays so that others donot have to face the same problem as we faced. More

title: Use to be best in India , not now !!!
review_text: Kolkata Zoological Garden once upon a time was the best in India. Even I have heard people comparing it with London Zoo. They use to have a wide selection of Animal, Birds, Reptile etc. But now a days there are not so many varieties to be seen, even the place is not maintained well.

title: Excellent place for children
review_text:
I have visited the zoo a number of times beginning right from my childhood uptil now. The last visit was 2 days ago. While it is an excellent place to take children (and even adults), with a large number of animals... I do need to give some other information, ie, parking. If you are visiting during the any holiday, or a Saturday or Sunday, it's better you take public transportation. There is very limited space for parking around the area... My husband and I were on a bike, trying to find a parking spot nearby... We had to take 2 rounds just to find the bike parking. It's on the footpath opposite, but very few bikes can be parked there... At most, 20 or so. Ditto for cars. 
Other than this, it's a good place for a family picnic as well.... You can carry your own food, sit on the grass or a sheet... And enjoy! There are ice cream stalls all over, and so is drinking water... However, the toilets are best avoided... Go there only if you are in a desperate situation. 
Every time I go, there are changes, and that makes me go back again and again! More

title: NEVER GO
review_text:
I wasn't sure about going and very tentative to begin with but after reading some positive information in the lonely planet, my sister and I decided to go. I was horrified as soon as I arrived. Dirty, tiny, concrete cages, awful conditions that i thought I would never see in my lifetime. 
The Jackal was left in a rusty, smelly cage on his own, surrounded by his own excretion. I can't even begin to describe the sadness in his eyes. 
The Tigers once again kept on their own. One walked back and forward near the exit, ignoring all the gorging visitors. 
The Elephants were in a enclosure which can only be described as front garden, with a massive ditch all around it to ensure they wouldn't escape. 

I won't go on anymore as to how horrific and terrible this zoo was, but please never go, these animals are like prisoners, but hey haven't done anything wrong. More

title: Zoo
review_text: Big zoo IN the middle of a city. Oldest zoo in India. All animals are available. Tickets are very nominal price. Walking is the only way to see all.
